data.title: Rockwell College
data.text:
Rockwell College is proud to announce the success of its recent fundraiser in support of The Alzheimer Society of Ireland. Organised by members of the Student Representative Council (SRC), the event not only raised significant funds but also heightened awareness for this important cause.

The fundraiser, held last Friday, saw enthusiastic participation from students, teachers, and staff, who donned denim attire in various styles, from single to quintuple denim, showcasing their support for Alzheimer's Ireland. Their collective effort resulted in an impressive donation of €887.00.

Alzheimer's Ireland, renowned for its tireless efforts in providing crucial support and services to individuals living with dementia and their families, will benefit greatly from the generosity of the Rockwell College community. The funds raised will contribute to their ongoing mission of enhancing the lives of those affected by dementia while advocating for advancements in treatment and research.

The SRC is pictured presenting the cheque to Catherine Bartels from Le Cairde Day Care Centre, Clonmel.

Rockwell College extends its heartfelt gratitude to everyone involved in making this fundraiser a resounding success, reaffirming the power of collective action in effecting positive change.

Photo Caption: The Student Representative Council (SRC) presents a cheque to Catherine Bartels from Le Cairde Day Care Centre, Clonmel.

From March 12th to 14th, Rockwell College became the stage for an unforgettable spectacle as Oliver Jr presented by Rockwell Music Academy Ltd, enthralled audiences with its charm and talent.

Under the adept direction of Suzanne Buttimer, the production blossomed into a delightful fusion of music, dance, and artistry. Buttimer's guidance ensured that every aspect of the show, from the brilliant sets to the exquisite costumes, captured the essence of Victorian London with authenticity and flair.

The musical talents of the cast, skilfully directed by Buttimer, brought the beloved characters to life with sincerity and emotion. Their performances, enhanced by choreographed dance numbers, painted a vivid picture of the timeless tale of "Oliver Twist."

Prior to the show, Ben Alston, portraying Oliver, received a special message of encouragement from Mark Lester, the iconic Oliver Twist from the 1968 film. Alston, in turn, shared this heartwarming gesture with the rest of the cast, inspiring them to deliver a truly memorable show.

As the curtains rose and the melodies filled the air, "Oliver Jr" unfolded with brilliance and grace. The audience was swept away by the captivating performances, each scene leaving a lasting impression of joy and wonder.

In the end, "Oliver Jr" stood as a testament to the talent and dedication of the entire cast and crew. Buttimer's expert direction, coupled with the musical prowess of the performers, created an enchanting theatrical experience that will be cherished for years to come.

Tag Rugby Blitz for Local National School Pupils

Rockwell College was alive with excitement last Wednesday, April 24th, as it hosted a thrilling Tag Rugby Blitz that brought together 440 children from 16 different National Schools across 4th, 5th, and 6th classes. The sun blessed the college's rugby pitches, adding to the festive atmosphere of the day.

With 52 teams in action, the event showcased the ever-growing popularity of rugby in the local community, attracting both boys and girls to participate. Young athletes demonstrated their skills and sportsmanship, embodying the values of teamwork and fair play that rugby instils.

The participating National School pupils relished a day filled with excitement and healthy competition, while enjoying the excellent facilities and warm hospitality provided by Rockwell College. Lunch was generously served in the student refectories, ensuring that the young athletes remained fuelled for their matches.

While teachers and staff worked tirelessly behind the scenes to ensure the event's success, special recognition is due to the TY and 5th-year students of Rockwell College. Not only did they play pivotal roles in organizing and running the event, but they also served as inspiring role models for the younger generation, infusing the day with their enthusiasm and energy.

Looking ahead, Rockwell College plans to make the Tag Rugby Blitz a yearly event, building on its resounding success. With a steadfast commitment to nurturing a love for sport and instilling positive values in young people, the college continues to play a vital role in the local community's sporting landscape.

Rockwell College is delighted to share the fantastic news that our production of "Oliver Jr.," helmed by Suzanne Buttimer from the Rockwell Music Academy, has garnered an impressive 11 nominations for the esteemed Stars Of Tomorrow - Secondary School Show Awards 2024, presented by Spotlight Studios.

These nominations stand as a testament to the dedication and talent of our entire cast, crew, and the supportive parents/guardians who have been instrumental in bringing this production to life.

Here is the list of the 11 nominations:

Best Upcycled Show

Best Emotionally Moving Performance for Ben Alston in "Where is Love"

Best Costumes

Best Set

Best Parent/Guardian Support

Best Student Leadership Role for Ciara Mohally

Best Exceptional Fellowship Award for Jamie Whelan

Best Behind the Scenes Team

Best Props

Best Live Music for Student Orchestra

The Star of Tomorrow Award for John Bambury

These nominations span a range of categories, highlighting the excellence and creativity that has been poured into every aspect of our production.

From the poignant performances that have touched the hearts of audiences, to the meticulous craftsmanship evident in our costumes and set design, each nomination reflects the passion and dedication of our students and staff.

As we eagerly await the results, all eyes are on the upcoming awards ceremony at the Ashdown Park Hotel in Gorey, Co. Wexford, on June 4th, 2024. The entire Rockwell community is rallying behind our nominees, ready to celebrate their achievements and cheer them on!

Congratulations to all the nominees for their hard work and dedication. Your talent and commitment have truly shone through, and we couldn't be prouder. Here's to a night of celebration and recognition for the shining stars of "Oliver Jr."

Hear From Our Alumni

Explore the transformative experiences of past expatriate pupils at Rockwell College through their full testimonials. Gain valuable insights into the academic, social, and personal growth opportunities that await your child at Rockwell. Discover firsthand accounts of how Rockwell College has shaped the futures of its students and prepared them for success in the global arena.

"As an Irish national, born and raised in the Middle East, the thought of moving back to Ireland to go to Boarding School was a daunting thought. Any worries I had quickly evaporated once I stepped foot in Rockwell and its magnificent grounds for the first time. Living in dorms was an amazing experience, the facilities are comfortable and modern and - between the games room, cinema room, gym, lake...I could go on - it sometimes felt like a holiday! The pastoral staff and Deans at the residence were patient, thoughtful and understanding - they were well equipped to deal with any issues or homesickness that inevitably arises at some stage. Boarding at Rockwell, gave me an incredible opportunity to grow, as a young adult, a student and a sportsman. It was an incredible experience which I could not recommend enough - I am still in frequent contact with staff and my friends from my school days and will be for life!" Daryl Egan, class of 2016

"During my five years of boarding Rockwell College played a pivotal role in shaping my future, bridging my upbringing in Bahrain with newfound experiences. Guided by excellence and inspired by the achievements of past alumni, Rockwell nurtured me to achieve my highest potential. It fostered a love of learning, an ability to manage my time efficiently and it is where I made lifelong friendships . I am so grateful for my time there setting the stage for my journey towards becoming an Olympian." Harry Mc Nulty, class of 2011

“I was raised in the Middle East, my family lived in Bahrain and I did my primary education there too. When I was 13 I joined Rockwell and went straight into Second year as a full-time boarder. The culture shock wasn’t that hard, I’m half Irish/Filipino myself but also there were many other international students. In a sense, I felt very much at home in the boarding house whichever way I looked at it. My fellow boarders were from across Ireland and abroad, it was always fun and we created strong bonds over the years. The school itself was excellent and looking back now over 10 years later, they provide many opportunities and support. I’m dyslexic and was given the extra help I needed in the classroom and during study periods in the evening.” Jack Sutcliffe, class of 2011

“Rockwell college provided me with an exceptional education through its academic programme. Being born and educated in the Middle East, returning to Rockwell for my final years of secondary education was a pivotal decision. In addition to its educational excellence, the college offers a multitude of sporting opportunities. I was fortunate to leave Rockwell with what have proved to be life long friends.” Shane Stapleton, class of 2000

Rockwell College Students Triumph at Tipperary County Final of Student Enterprise Programme

On Friday, February 23, the Tipperary County Final of the Student Enterprise Programme for secondary school entrepreneurs took place at TUS, Thurles. Organised by the Local Enterprise Offices of Ireland, the programme, now in its 22nd year, was the largest enterprise initiative for second-level students in the country.

Over 25,000 students from approximately 500 second-level schools across Ireland participated in the programme, aimed at fostering entrepreneurship and innovation among young people.

In a recent highlight, two exceptional students from Rockwell College, Paddy Corcoran and Jack Lane, emerged victorious, clinching the prestigious AIB Entrepreneurial Award for their groundbreaking venture, Speedwayx, at the Tipperary Enterprise Awards. The event, organised by Enterprise Ireland in collaboration with Tipperary Local Enterprise Office, showcased the ingenuity and determination of local entrepreneurs.

Paddy Corcoran and Jack Lane’s remarkable achievement underscored their exceptional dedication and innovative approach in navigating the entrepreneurial landscape. Speedwayx, their brainchild, gained significant attention for its forward-thinking concepts and impactful solutions.

Their success not only reflected the vibrant entrepreneurial spirit thriving within the community but also highlighted Rockwell College’s commitment to fostering creativity and ambition among its students. Corcoran and Lane’s win set a commendable example for aspiring entrepreneurs across the region.

The duo, alongside fellow pupil Sean Cahill who supported them during the event, and teacher John O’Meara, were pictured accepting their award. Their triumph secured their position to represent Tipperary at the National Final, which was scheduled to be held in May at the Mullingar Park Hotel.

As they prepared to showcase their entrepreneurial prowess on a national stage, Paddy Corcoran and Jack Lane stood as shining examples of the innovative potential nurtured within Tipperary’s educational landscape. Their journey exemplified the transformative power of entrepreneurship in shaping the future of our youth and our communities.
